article: Never would I forget the other night when I came across an unforgettable sight while watching the Olympics. It was not a gold medal, or a world record broken, but a _ of determination and courage. The _ was swimming and started with only three men on the blocks. Two of them, however, were disqualified due to _ starts. That left only one to _ . That would have been difficult enough, not having anyone to race _ . I watched the man dive off the _ and knew right away that something was _ . Now I'm not an expert swimmer but I do know a good dive from a poor one, and this man was far from being a medal winner. When he _ , it was clear that the man was not out for gold. I listened to the crowd begin to _ at this poor man that was clearly having a _ time. Finally he _ his turn to start back. It was pitiful. He made a few all-out strokes and you could _ he was worn out. _ in those few awkward strokes, the crowd had _ . No longer were they laughing, but beginning to _ . Some _ began to stand and yell things like, "Come on, you can do it!" and, "Go for it!" He did. A clear minute slower than the average swimmer, this young man finally finished his _ . The crowd went _ . You would have thought that he had won the gold, and he should have. Even though he recorded one of the slowest times in Olympic history, this man gave more heart than any of the other _ . A man that gave his all -- knowing that he had no chance, but competed because of the _ of the games.
